Description: Fragments of charred papyrus, mounted on paper (one side only visible). 13 fragments with c. 8 lines of Demotic on each fragment.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: To be studied by Kim Ryholt and Richard Jasnow. Jasnow commetns (pers. comm. 2008) 'fragments of a legal compilation, much like the Hermopolis Legal Code. "What is the law…" Ikh p3 hp. It has also several times the important legal term shar, "public protest,"'
Bibliographic references: Pattie & Turner 1974 / The Written Word on Papyrus: An Exhibition Held in the British Museum 30 July - 27 October 1974 (no.8)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380895) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380895)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: brittle, carbonised, displaced fragments, fragile Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Transferred to horizontal storage 8 FEB 95 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: E Curatorial condition comment: poor
